@graph.name: Bangalore Blockchain License User Group
@graph.description: An open source community in Bangalore focused on transparent, blockchain-powered compensation for open source contributors using the Open Compensation Token License (OCTL) framework.

mainEntity.name: What is the Bangalore Blockchain License User Group?

acceptedAnswer.text: It is a community in Bangalore that promotes and supports open source contributors using a transparent token mechanism governed by the Open Compensation Token License.

mainEntity.name: How can the Blockchain License help with open source sponsorship?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Open Compensation Token License provides a blockchain-based token system for sponsors and admirers to support contributors, ensuring accountability and fairness in distributing rewards.

mainEntity.name: Where can newcomers learn more or get involved?

acceptedAnswer.text: Developers can participate in Bangalore-based meetups, workshops, and hackathons hosted by the Blockchain License User Group to learn about token-based funding models and engage with sponsors.

mainEntity.name: How does the user group collaborate with other organizations?

acceptedAnswer.text: The group partners with local businesses, tech parks, and foundations to form collaborations or secure grants, emphasizing the transparency advantages provided by the Open Compensation Token License framework.
